verses.text: The heads of the fathers’ houses of the clan of the people of Gilead, son of Machir, son of Manasseh, of the clans of the sons of Joseph, came forward and spoke before Moses, and before the chiefs, the heads of the fathers' houses of the people of Israel.
verses.comment: Follows the Hebrew structure closely, retaining genealogical detail as in the original.

verses.text: They said, 'The LORD commanded my lord to give the land for inheritance by lot to the people of Israel. And my lord was commanded by the LORD to give the inheritance of Zelophehad our brother to his daughters.'
verses.comment: Maintains the formal address and references to earlier chapters.

verses.text: 'But if they are married to any of the sons of the other tribes of the people of Israel, then their inheritance will be taken from the inheritance of our fathers and added to the inheritance of the tribe into which they marry; so it will be taken away from the lot of our inheritance.'
verses.comment: Faithful to the original scenario about tribal inheritance.

verses.text: 'And when the Jubilee of the people of Israel comes, then their inheritance will be added to the inheritance of the tribe into which they marry; and their inheritance will be taken from the inheritance of the tribe of our fathers.'
Then Moses commanded the people of Israel according to the word of the LORD, saying, 'What the tribe of the sons of Joseph is saying is right.'
verses.comment: Direct speech aligned with the Hebrew.

verses.text: 'This is what the LORD commands concerning the daughters of Zelophehad: “Let them marry whom they think best, only they must marry within the clan of the tribe of their father.”'
verses.comment: Close translation; 'let them marry whom they think best' is literal Hebrew phrasing.

verses.text: 'So no inheritance of the people of Israel shall be transferred from tribe to tribe, for every one of the people of Israel shall hold to the inheritance of the tribe of his fathers.'
verses.comment: Follows the command about inheritance within tribes.

verses.text: 'And every daughter who possesses an inheritance in any tribe of the people of Israel shall marry one from the clan of the tribe of her father, so that every one of the people of Israel may possess the inheritance of his fathers.'
'So no inheritance shall be transferred from one tribe to another tribe, for each tribe of the people of Israel shall hold on to its own inheritance.'
verses.comment: Repetition in the original is preserved.

verses.text: The daughters of Zelophehad did as the LORD commanded Moses.
verses.comment: Simple, direct sentence, as in the Hebrew.

verses.text: For Mahlah, Tirzah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Noah, the daughters of Zelophehad, were married to sons of their uncles.
verses.comment: Original wording retained; 'sons of their uncles' translates literally.

verses.text: They were married into the clans of the sons of Manasseh the son of Joseph, and their inheritance remained in the tribe of the clan of their father.
These are the commandments and the rules that the LORD commanded through Moses to the people of Israel in the plains of Moab by the Jordan at Jericho.
verses.comment: Closing formula; phrase 'by the Jordan at Jericho' as in Hebrew.
